title: A2141 820-01700 - 5v / .454a all four ports
message:
Have a A2141 no power complaint.  Board is out, I'm measuring 5v, .454a draw on all four ports.  Voltage @ F700 jumps between 7.87v and 8.77v.

What can I check next?

title: A2141 820-01700 - 5v / .454a all four ports
message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Any history available?
Be aware, this machine requires 96, or 140W charger.
Try with battery connected too.
Remove both F7000/1 and check C7050 voltage.

title: A2141 820-01700 - 5v / .454a all four ports
message: Hey!  Thanks for the response!  No history available unfortunately.  Although my customers tend to purposely leave out details it seems.  I am using an OEM 100W apple USBc power adapter for reference.  With F7000/1 removed, I am getting 12.32v @ C7050.

title: A2141 820-01700 - 5v / .454a all four ports
message:
Now resolder the fuses and check if 3V3_G3H_RTC is stable.
What about PPBUS_G3H voltage with both charger and battery connected?

title: A2141 820-01700 - 5v / .454a all four ports
message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 102840, member: 682"]
Now resolder the fuses and check if 3V3_G3H_RTC is stable.
What about PPBUS_G3H voltage with both charger and battery connected?
[/QUOTE]
3.384v steady at C3100 which is 3v3_G3H_RTC_X

title: A2141 820-01700 - 5v / .454a all four ports
message:
Please, don't quote an entire message, visible few centimeters above.

The expected SLPS2R and AWAKE voltages stable too?
Is the machine recognized into DFU mode?

title: A2141 820-01700 - 5v / .454a all four ports
message: I'm looking up SLPS2R and AWAKE in the boardview but there are many.  Can you tell me a preferable measurement point?  This device does not show up in Apple Configurator.

title: A2141 820-01700 - 5v / .454a all four ports
message: Look at the small coils surrounding U7800...

title: A2141 820-01700 - 5v / .454a all four ports
message: OK, none are stable.  Some have 0-.8v fluctuations and others have 0-1.1v fluctuations.

title: A2141 820-01700 - 5v / .454a all four ports
message:
Did you test with both charger and battery connected?
Also try another known good 96/140W charger.

title: A2141 820-01700 - 5v / .454a all four ports
message: It was with the battery and charger connected.  I don't think I have another adapter.  This is the one I always use.  I'll order one and touch base again when it arrives and I test.

title: A2141 820-01700 - 5v / .454a all four ports
message: Verified, battery connected, brand new OEM 140W power adapter.

title: A2141 820-01700 - 5v / .454a all four ports
message:
U7800's LDOs fluctuate too?
Look at page 76.

title: A2141 820-01700 - 5v / .454a all four ports
message: C7905/6/14 all fluctuating.

title: A2141 820-01700 - 5v / .454a all four ports
message: Check voltage on both sides of R7900.

title: A2141 820-01700 - 5v / .454a all four ports
message: This is with battery now disconnected, since this item is on the back side of the board.  R7900 has constant 3.38v on both sides.

title: A2141 820-01700 - 5v / .454a all four ports
message:
Check diode mode to ground on all coils.
Compare with good board, if possible.
If not, use online reference table.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://openboarddata.org/?a=showboardsolutions&bpath=laptops/apple/820-01700[/URL]

title: A2141 820-01700 - 5v / .454a all four ports
message: Just power supply coils, or every single coil on the board?  That's maybe hundreds, so I'm assuming you mean just the power supply coils.  Can you confirm?

title: A2141 820-01700 - 5v / .454a all four ports
message:
I meant power supplies coils, of course.
Don't forget the ones from SSD areas.

title: A2141 820-01700 - 5v / .454a all four ports
message: Here you go!

title: A2141 820-01700 - 5v / .454a all four ports
message: Looks like bad CPU...

title: A2141 820-01700 - 5v / .454a all four ports
message: OK, thank you for all your help!   See you on the next one!
